message_1:
What is the enthalpy change of the following chemical reaction: 2SO2(g) + O2(g) → 2SO3(g), given the following reactions and their respective enthalpy changes:

1) 2SO2(g) + O2(g) → 2SO3(g)     ΔH = -198 kJ/mol
2) 2SO2(g) + S(s) → 3SO2(g)     ΔH = -296 kJ/mol
3) O2(g) + 2S(s) → 2SO2(g)      ΔH = -494 kJ/mol
message_2:
The enthalpy change for the given chemical reaction (2SO2(g) + O2(g) → 2SO3(g)) is already provided in the first reaction:

1) 2SO2(g) + O2(g) → 2SO3(g)     ΔH = -198 kJ/mol

So, the enthalpy change for the reaction is -198 kJ/mol.
